Definition: Translate the given English sentence to Swedish. Capitalize the noun if any and the first word of every sentence. Also, note to keep the numbers as it is.

Positive Examples.input: I declare resumed the session of the European Parliament adjourned on Friday 17 December 1999, and I would like once again to wish you a happy new year in the hope that you enjoyed a pleasant festive period.
Positive Examples.output: Jag förklarar Europaparlamentets session återupptagen efter avbrottet den 17 december. Jag vill på nytt önska er ett gott nytt år och jag hoppas att ni haft en trevlig semester.
Positive Examples.explanation: English sentence is properly converted into Swedish sentence.

Positive Examples.input: Please rise, then, for this minute' s silence.
Positive Examples.output: Jag ber er resa er för en tyst minut.
Positive Examples.explanation: English sentence is properly converted into Swedish sentence.

Positive Examples.input: Madam President, on a point of order.
Positive Examples.output: Fru talman! Det gäller en ordningsfråga.
Positive Examples.explanation: English sentence is properly converted into Swedish sentence.

Negative Examples.explanation: The conversion of English to Swedish is wrong because output missed one word from the input, i.e., session which means sessionen.

Negative Examples.input: Thank you, Mr Segni, I shall do so gladly.
Negative Examples.output: Hejdå, herr Segni, det skall jag gärna göra.
Negative Examples.explanation: The conversion of English to Swedish is wrong because Thank you means Tack not Hejdå.
